snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Friday, selections include the chairman of the Federal Trade commission defending the group's settlement with Google, some of the strange...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Friday, selections include the chairman of the Federal Trade commission defending the group's settlement with Google, some of the strange questions that big technology companies ask in job interviews and using Google Earth to find prison camps in North Korea.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Strange Hiring Questions and Curved Controls
